comments.commentBody: Our country has been meddling in other countries' elections for decades, .so what's new?  It doesn't make it right but let's move on .  It seemed that everybody who was somebody or who wanted to be somebody stopped by Trump Tower before the inauguration.

"Anybody ...who wanted to be somebody stopped" etc......given your supposition, and if that was the case, it begs the question what was Kislyak's doing at Trump Tower before! the election.  Perhaps Mr. Sessions has the answer to that, or even Mr. Trump.
There are dollars and rubles behind the Trump team.  Follow the money; the truth is there.

This is the 2nd time I've seen these specific concerns detailed in these comments, perhaps by the same writer. The scenario depicted should give the NYT and other heavyweights in journalism a swift kick to get to the bottom, as it should the CIA and FBI, though I assume they've been compromised, or at least ordered away from this topic. I expect the worst, actually, I believe Trump and many of his gop enablers are guilty of treason. So far neither DJT or anyone in his entourage has been held to account, and with his AG totally in the pocket there will likely be no serious investigations. a large number of transgressions, obvious violations of law and blatant lies have been given a pass, the same kind of stuff that the GOP would have skewered HRC or Obama for, then put their heads on pikes outside the capitol. I hope this can be brought out in light bright enough that even the dimmest of us can see, before our republic is lost. I believe that is a very real possibility.

I am really tired of hearing Sessions is such a gentleman and nice guy. He is the worst sort of "nice guy". He uses his demeanor to lull one into believing he has noble causes. Then boom, out comes the pen, and you end up in the pen.

Let's keep an eye on James Comey, with the power to obstruct a thorough investigation of his boss Jeff Sessions. Comey also owes Trump, for extending his appointment as FBI head. Independent prosecutor now!
Am I the only one wondering why the Russian Ambassador was at the Republican Convention?
No, you are not alone.

Anything is possible - that is why we have to let it play out - I'm not judging one way or the other until the water clears. You have already taken sides which I think, is premature and dangerous, because you demonstrate no objectivity. I am not registered with either party and truthfully - they both put me to shame.

This is so beautifully written, Amy. So much love and soul into your writing for Jason, most of all, for the world to see. So much courage, too as you face what might well be your last days and still give 110% and more. I am in awe of your determination, care and honesty. I wish you peace, joy and more love.

P.S. Me and my 8 year old son, Gabriel love your books esp Spoon =).
Wow.

And this - I once read that those who were happily married and then lose a spouse and are those who remarry soonest, seeking to re-create that joy. Those unhappily married are far less likely to remarry, seeking to avoid that pain.

My younger brother literally dropped dead from a totally unsuspected, garden variety heart attack two weeks after his 60th birthday, leaving behind a wife and two nearly-grown sons. I have come to better know this lovely, exceptional  woman since then and am convinced that my brother would have wanted one lucky man to find and love and care for his wonderful wife when the time was right, when the worst of the grieving was done, when life's joys seems possible again. Thank you so very much for writing what he had no time to do so.

You forgot the most important reason. He had the taste and sense to marry you. I married one of your sort myself. MD Anderson in Houston saved her. They do things there when no one else can. Please try to live.
Please stop pushing medical "miracles" on those who may not want the punishing treatments to continue. Conceit at its most damaging.

I wish someone would write about the fact that in approximately 15 states teachers don't receive their spouses social security annuity if the spouse dies. They get zero despite the fact their spouse has put thousands of dollars into social security annually. I know teachers who's husbands have passed and they receive no social security from their husband's investment into social security.

Re spousal social security: at least in California you can collect spousal social security only if your benefit from Social Security will be higher than your teacher's pension. For career teachers, their teacher's pension pays more therefore they lose the spousal benefit of social security. Teachers should fact check this before retiring and monitor any rule changes thereafter. Congress has changed Social Security regs in off election years such as raising minimum age to receive full benefits.

In Connecticut, public school teachers are not eligible to receive Social Security. Connecticut is one of sixteen states in which teachers only receive pensions. And Republicans in the Constitution State are pushing hard to eliminate pensions.

So Connecticut teachers are looking at badly underfunded pensions (courtesy of sixteen years of Republican governors), they can't receive Social Security, and their 4013b accounts are total rip-off's.

@ C Jean Pearlstein - I believe you are referring to the Government Pension Offset and it also applies to federal retirees in the old federal pension plan (CSRS) who did not pay SS taxes when working and are not entitled to collect SS benefits based on their own work history.  These retirees usually can't collect spousal SS because their own pension is higher than SS.  CSRS is an excellent pension, I wish I had it,  but it does have some drawbacks.

Wow!  Did you not notice that money was being deducted from your paycheck for something you claim to have not signed up for?  Most people would ask about a pay-stub line item that appeared out of the blue and didn't seem legitimate.

Thank you for sharing and celebrating your feelings for just how fabulous your man is. I have a similar fellow - very caring and fun.
It sounds like you are leaving at the worst time - but at least there is no unfinished business. You made a home and managed to get all three kids out of the house. It wass my biggest fear that I will die one day and my husband will have to continue to raise our kids without me. But the more we know each other (it's been about 8 years now), the less I worry about this. My husband continues to surprise me with his abilities. I wish you great joy in your next life, and may be more time with whoever you choose :)
Who sold uranium to the Russians again??
Just for your information, that quote you made attributing it to Albert Einstein is actually  from the Bible.

Get Trump's tax returns. That's what needs to happen. Follow the money. As history has already shown, that's where the story leads.
Did you notice how silly and thoroughly awkward Trump looked wearing that jacket and hat on his visit to the ship this week trying to pretend to be earnestly presidential? Yet he can maintain this facade indefinitely unless the money trail is uncovered. Remember: Trump's own son announced that the Trump organization had money "pouring in from Russia" several years ago. Was the son lying?
Trump knows he's a liar who only cares about money and he has met his match with Putin. We are all caught in the middle unless we can find a way to follow the money.

The article describes International Republican Institute as "an American democracy-building group". Shouldn't  we similarly categorize alleged disclosures of information  Hillary Clinton would prefer to keep from the electorate as "democracy-building"? Same may be said of the Obama administration spying on Trump campaign figures, although that appears as a page from a totalitarian regime's playbook.

The meeting that Mr. Greenblatt had with Rabbi Lazar isn't being scrutinized because Mr Greenblatt admitted tot he meeting's happening, he can justify the reason for the meeting and he can explain what was discussed.
The meeting that Mr. Gordon had with Russian's ambassador isn't being scrutinized because it was at an event at which ambassadors from many other countries both friendly and hostile were present. It wasn't a case of he spoke to Russia, only Russia, nobody else but Russia.

Jeff Sessions meeting with the Russian ambassador in his office is being subject to scrutiny because he lied about it while under oath in his own confirmation hearing, because other members of the Senate Armed Services Committee on which Sessions had a seat have gone on record as saying that meetings with the Russian ambassador are not usual fare for them. Because it is not the meeting itself that people find so suspicious, rather it is his attempt to deny it and cover it up.

As for Michael Flynn, had not misled the VP (and through him, misled the American people) about his calls to the Russian ambassador on the day Obama kicked out 35 diplomat-spies, and had he just admitted to the fact he asked the Russians not to retaliate against the incoming administration, and the Trump administration would more or less do whatever Moscow wanted in return for this... But no, he lied, investigations happened and he lost his job.
It seems a bit coincidental that two of Trump’s three wives are Eastern European natives.   Has it always been that difficult for NY billionaires to find a more local mate?

The Republican National Convention was July 18th thru July 21st.
Russian spy agencies stolen emails were first published by WikiLeaks on July 22, 2016.
Trump happily used hacked emails from the Democrats on the trail, celebrating a steal/ leak political sabotage by Russians.

USA NSA head: '“This was a conscious effort by a nation-state (Russia) to attempt to achieve a specific effect.”
FBI security expert Shawn Henry: shocked FBI didn't send agent in person to the DNC headquarters:
FBI Special Agent Hawkins: only warned DNC, never went in person to assist Democrats in dealing with hack. Despite being one mile away.
Next, Hillary's opponent, Bernie Sanders improperly gained access to Hillary Clinton's data.

On July 6, 12 days before the Republican National Convention began in Cleveland, Russia released the DNC's operational plans and budget for countering GOP.
Reince Priebus, then head of RNC, refused to condemn Russia hacks + has directly worked with Trump to this day.
All knew in advance about Russia's plan:
Days before the Podesta email release began, Roger Stone, Republican operative working with Trump campaign, sent out "an excited tweet" on exactly was coming.

The Trump team's denied Russian contacts since July 24th, starting with Paul Manafort, who worked for Ukrainian President Yanukovych, a Putin ally.
Pro-Russian language was added to RNC platform. An upset Rachel Hoff, then on the platform, said "Trump is dangerous for America + the world.”

I feel so bad about the impact of revelations of fascist Russia committing an act of war against the US with help from a traitorous presidential campaign on the comfort level of oligarch-loving Russophiles when they are in Moscow.  Cry me a river.

Donald. I feel sorry for him. It was sad watching the inauguration and seeing him basking pompously as lousy c-list country singers did their own version of strange fruit. It was really really sad. Mr Trump should run when he can as Saddam Hussein should have. Run Don run, as I would imagine Vlad will give you sanctuary and you can have a KFC with Ed Snowden. Surely you have  a fortune over there. Don't you? You are popular in Russia whenever Vlad gives the nod. You can bask in glory and see Alaska from there.

Consider the LIES coming from Trump and his administration ... about everything.

But yes, why was the Trump campaign in constant contact with the Russians? For that matter why was Kislyak at the RNC? Has the Republican Party become a foreign toadie to Putin's Russia like so many communist parties in the west were to Stalin? Was Kislyak there to signify that Trump was Putin's chosen lackey for us? I sure looks like it!

Are the Republicans oblivious? Strong anti-communism used to be close to the heart and soul of Republicanism, and how many times have Republicans run on red-baiting their Democratic opponents? How many of you are old enough to remember "Red down to her underwear?"

But now the GOP has been taken over by adoration of Putin, and a president whose campaign was constantly talking to the Russians ... about what?

Taken together with the Russian hacking and cyberwar, and Trump's history of business dealings with Russians

"Donald Trump Jr., told the global trade publication eTurboNews that Russians were key investors in the Trump Organization’s assets. "And in terms of high-end product influx into the US, Russians make up a pretty disproportionate cross-section of a lot of our assets; say in Dubai, and certainly with our project in SoHo and anywhere in New York,” Trump Jr. said in the interview."

It stinks.
The Russians are laughing at us.. and it isn't because of Trump...
